tool.name: TopographicWetnessIndex

param.name: DEM
param.dialogReference:
Input digital elevation model. This can be any ArcGIS-recognized raster type. The elevation derivatives are calculated using compiled Fortran programs (BuildGrids.exe and MakeGrids.exe) that read a binary floating point raster. If the specified DEM is of another format, the script should convert it to the .flt format.

All output rasters are saved to the directory of the input DEM.

param.name: Length Scale
param.dialogReference: Length in meters over which to calculate the topographic attributes (gradient, plan curvature, B contour) needed for calculating TWI, applying a smoothing effect proportional to the value. Defaults to 0.

param.name: grad
param.dialogReference: Optional path to an existing gradient raster as calculated using this tool or the Surface Metrics tool. If none is provided, a new gradient raster will be calculated from the input DEM and saved to its directory.

param.name: plan
param.dialogReference: Optional path to an existing plan curvature raster as calculated using this tool or the Surface Metrics tool. If none is provided, a new plan curvature raster will be calculated from the input DEM and saved to its directory.

param.name: bcon
param.dialogReference:
Optional path to an existing plan curvature raster as calculated from a previous use of this tool. If none is provided, a new B contour raster will be calculated from the input DEM and saved to its directory.

B contour is the contour length crossed by flow exiting the cell at the specified length scale, and gives a measure of topographic convergence.

param.name: Scratch
param.dialogReference: Folder for hard-disk work space used during calculation of elevation derivatives. If you have a fast solid-state drive, you can specify a scratch directory there to help reduce run time. Defaults to the location of the input DEM.

param.name: executablePath
param.dialogReference: This tool uses separate compiled programs (MakeGrids.exe and BuildGrids.exe). If the script cannot find them in the current scratch directory, you need to specify their location here.

tool.summary: Calculates the Topographic Wetness Index at each cell of a DEM, based on gradient and flow accumulation calculations.
